html:
381 U.S. 763

85 S.Ct. 1810

14 L.Ed.2d 723

Walter Frank KNOWLES
v.
FLORIDA.

No. 884, Misc.

Supreme Court of the United States

June 7, 1965

Walter Frank Knowles, pro se.

Earl Faircloth, Atty. Gen. of Florida, and George R. Georgieff, Asst. Atty. Gen., for respondent.

On Petition for Writ of Certiorari to the Supreme Court of Florida.

PER CURIAM.

1

The petition for writ of certiorari is granted and the judgment dismissing the appeal is reversed. Raley v. State of Ohio, 360 U.S. 423, 437-440, 79 S.Ct. 1257 1265-1268, 3 L.Ed.2d 1344. Cf. Lane v. Brown, 372 U.S. 477, 83 S.Ct. 768, 9 L.Ed.2d 892; Douglas v. People of State of California, 372 U.S. 353, 83 S.Ct. 814, 9 L.Ed.2d 811.

2

Mr. Justice STEWART would deny certiorari.

3

Mr. Justice CLARK and Mr. Justice HARLAN dissent.
